metadata.Title: CVE-2020-2780 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: DML). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.47 and prior,5.7.29 and prior and 8.0.19 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.5 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-router - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.20-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.20-0ubuntu1').
